newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish government bonds ended slightly lower on Friday in line with other European markets amid dull trade.
With little domestic news on the agenda, dealers said they lacked trading ideas. Outside Spain, the European Commission confirmed that Italy's proposed eurotax would be allowed for the 1997 budget.
But the market did not react in any significant way.
"We limited ourselves to tracking Bunds," a dealer in Madrid said. As a result the 10-year spread over Bunds remained stuck at 120 basis points.
But a relatively strong peseta, recovering from a bout of high volatility earlier this week, was boosting prices at the short end of the yield curve.

The curve steepened further today, with the three- to 10-year spread widening to 123 basis points from 120 bps and the five- to 10-year differential to 96 basis points from 93 bps. -- Madrid Newsroom, + 341 585 8340
